question_text: Which of the following statements about the evolution of DDR memory are true? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Each new DDR generation increases data transfer rates.
DDR memory versions are physically incompatible with each other.
DDR4 modules can be used in DDR3 slots with an adapter.
DDR5 offers faster communication between memory and CPU than DDR4.
Backward compatibility is not a design priority in DDR memory advancements.
correct_answer: Each new DDR generation increases data transfer rates.
DDR memory versions are physically incompatible with each other.
DDR5 offers faster communication between memory and CPU than DDR4.
Backward compatibility is not a design priority in DDR memory advancements.
explanation: DDR improvements focus on speed and bandwidth, not on maintaining backward compatibility.
